body:
@tyb197 the two mAPs are consistent. The mAP in training is produced by test.py directly after each epoch. The problem is likely that you are using two different datasets. You need to make sure to pass the same exact *.data file to both:

```
python3 train.py --data coco2014.data
python3 test.py --data coco2014.data
```

The only remaining difference may be image size used for training and testing.

> @tyb197 the two mAPs are consistent. The mAP in training is produced by test.py directly after each epoch. The problem is likely that you are using two different datasets. You need to make sure to pass the same exact *.data file to both:
> 
> ```
> python3 train.py --data coco2014.data
> python3 test.py --data coco2014.data
> ```
> 
> The only remaining difference may be image size used for training and testing.

@glenn-jocher
Ah, that's it. I didn't change the img-size when I run test.py, the default setting is 416. And the img-size in train.py is 512, is that mean after each epoch it will test at 512*512 resolution?

Now I am training on my own dataset(actually it is part of coco2017, I just pick some classes I need), and I use the pre-trained model. Since the yolov3.pt was pre-trained on coco datasets, I change the lr0 from 0.01 to 0.001 and lrf 0.005 to 0.0001 to finetune on my own dataset for 100 epochs. Now the loss on the validation set starts to rise a little bit after about 50 epochs, but mAP is still a little bit lower than my ideal level. Is there any way to improve mAP while preventing the model from overfitting?

@tyb197 your code may be out of date. The current code displays train and test sizes when training starts, and the current default test size is 512. Use git pull to get the latest code, or simply clone the repo again.

For best results you should train with all default settings, i.e. yolov3-spp.cfg with yolov3-spp-ultrlaytics.pt.
ï¼¯K, I'll try. Thanks a lot for your reply!

I met the same problem. I ensure the parameters are consistent between the train.py and test.py, but the mAP of each epoch is different. The mAP is 0.485 in training however 0.964 in test.py. Did you solve this problem?
@1184919257 then you are simply passing different parameters to test.py, as train calls test.py directly after each epoch.

@1184919257 The test result is normal, cause the conf-thres is 0.1 in train.py to speed up test process during train, and the conf-thres is 0.001 in test.py.
And also check the img-size.
@tyb197 yes we did use different `--conf` before for train and test, but we've updated to use the same value now. Please `git pull` or reclone to get the latest code.

> @tyb197 yes we did use different `--conf` before for train and test, but we've updated to use the same value now. Please `git pull` or reclone to get the latest code.

thank a lot. I find this problem is'not caused by the conf-thres or img-size, becuase i'm very sure that they are consistent. It caused by muti-GPUs training. When i used one GPU to train, the mAP is same between train.py and test.py, but not same when I use muti-GPUs.
And the train.py has another bug, in line393,when i set the device='6,7', it didn't take effect and uesd the all 8 GPUs. But it take effect in the test,py.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/32363554/81766133-1bfc0680-9508-11ea-8c6e-41f852624815.png)
@1184919257 there is no bug, youâve incorrectly modified the argparser.
